column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////I guess there's not a whole lot to add here. The thick noodles here are definitely better
column2: and I thought the tonkotsu was pretty delish. A lot of people rave about the chicken broth
column3: but I haven't had a chance to try it yet. If you come during happy hour
column4: the jinya bun is only $3. Service is quite average
column5: and it depends on you server. Sometimes it's really attentive and sometimes it's lacking. I'd call in during peak hours because there's sometimes a pretty long line. Parking can also be hard to find
column6: but not impossible. Pretty great ramen here
